Change has been successfully merged
Typo, fixed.
Done
Can you give more information here?  I can't understand what any of this means.  Is json-schema giving you errors or something?
Every resource type having an ID is useful for debug purposes when reading through generated logs. Added more explanation in the commit message.
Done
Suggest keeping file identifiers here to avoid collisions.

I guess it is still not clear to me what this diff is doing and why.
   
Why should we have any particular 'id' name?  Should there be any correlation to the purpose of the sub-object?  Should they be named after Atlantic storms?  How unique should they be?
It's not clear to me why "armprocessor" is removed from the bulk of these.  The registers here are clearly ARM and not x86.  Should we be removing "armprocessor" in this file?  Why?

I'm not following what you mean by removed?

These all exist under cper-json-arm-processor-section, so adding arm-processor to these IDs would be redundant, no?
Oh, I was reviewing the diff between PS1 and PS4 since that's where I last gave comments.
Gotcha, sounds like this is answered.  Closing.
Again, why are we removing all of these?
Between patchset 1-4, ia32x54 is already covered by the base $id on line 2.
Done
I'm worried about potential collisions here.  In fact, you now have a collision in the next file.
Can you elaborate on "collisions"? Not following
@Patrick?

It wasn't clear that these entries only need to be object-unique (file-unique).  I thought these were IDs for the record itself.  I assumed we would want them globally unique.  I'll mark this as resolved.

(I was also partially confused because one iteration of this patch had "memory-cper-json-bank0", etc. names on each IDs so they _were_ globally unique and then it was removed.)

TBH, I don't even understand why "cper-json-" is here on them.  Why isn't it just "bank0" and "bank1"?
Remove.
Done

I marked my comment earlier about collisions as "resolved" but this text is what makes me not even certain what a "good" `$id` is.  If we need to be able to "uniquely identif[y] a nested child property" don't the IDs have to be unique?

> If you're referring to cper-json-bank0/1 in cper-memory and cper-memory2, they're the same object. 

If they are the same object why are we defining them twice?  Shouldn't there be a common definition?

> Their parent $id can be used to identify them.

I don't know what you mean by this.  There is no other $id above those in the hierarchy.

> If they are the same object why are we defining them twice? Shouldn't there be a common definition?

You're right, imo it's easier to have them inline than maintain 2 separate schema files for a "value" or "object" property. Open to thoughts. 

> I don't know what you mean by this. There is no other $id above those in the hierarchy.

Since these are sections, they're only referenced in the "sections" property. The top level object in "sections" is where the parent $id needs to live for uniqueness. https://gerrit.openbmc.org/plugins/gitiles/openbmc/libcper/+/refs/changes/51/74751/13/specification/json/cper-json-section-log.json#46
Done
I suspect this collision might be an issue, but I suspect we can iterate on this.  as-is I still think this is an improvement
